data.title: Comedian Kevin Durham
data.text:
Puppet love #shorts A clip from my upcoming feature film B-Movie. David was an ordinary guy with an extraordinary passionâ€”puppet love. Now, weâ€™re not talking about your average â€œI like puppetsâ€ kind of affection. No, David was utterly, completely, and irrevocably in love with the idea of creating epic, heart-wrenching, and often hilariously over-the-top love stories between his two hand puppets, Mr. Fluffy and Lady Snuggles. Every evening after work, while most people were unwinding with a cup of tea or binge-watching the latest series, David was busy brewing the next episode of his puppet love saga. His living room became a theater, his hands the stage, and his imagination the writerâ€™s room for the next big puppet love hit. One day, David decided that it was time for a dramatic twist. Mr. Fluffy, a well-groomed, top-hat-wearing rabbit, was going to propose to Lady Snuggles, the sweetest, fluffiest cat puppet youâ€™ve ever seen. But hereâ€™s the catchâ€”David wanted the proposal to be something out of this world. After all, when it comes to puppet love, youâ€™ve got to go big or go home! David crafted an elaborate scene: a moonlit rooftop, a tiny string quartet of sock puppets, and Mr. Fluffy on one knee, holding a diamond ring the size of a jellybean. â€œLady Snuggles,â€ Mr. Fluffy began, â€œfrom the moment I first saw you at the puppet laundromat, I knew you were the one. You were the only one who didnâ€™t lose a button eye in the spin cycle. Will you make me the happiest puppet in the world and marry me?â€ David, fully immersed in the moment, accidentally knocked over the string quartet, sending them tumbling down the imaginary rooftop. â€œOh no, the band!â€ David exclaimed. But he quickly recovered, making Mr. Fluffy look over the edge and say, â€œEh, itâ€™s okay, they were playing off-key anyway.â€ Just as Lady Snuggles was about to answer, David realized he hadnâ€™t decided whether she should say yes or introduce a plot twist. The tension in the room was palpable. â€œThis is puppet love at its finest,â€ David muttered to himself, wiping a tear from his eye. But then, the doorbell rang. It was Davidâ€™s neighbor, Mrs. Jenkins, who had heard the commotion. She looked around, confused, as David opened the door with both hands still inside the puppets. â€œDavid, is everything alright?â€ Mrs. Jenkins asked, eyeing the puppet theater setup. â€œOh, yes, Mrs. Jenkins! Just another chapter in the epic saga of puppet love!â€ David replied enthusiastically, as Mr. Fluffy waved at her. Mrs. Jenkins squinted at the puppets. â€œPuppet love, you say? Youâ€™re really into this, arenâ€™t you?â€ David, never one to miss a beat, made Lady Snuggles reply, â€œIndeed, Mrs. Jenkins! Puppet love is the purest love there is!â€ Mrs. Jenkins chuckled, â€œWell, David, as long as youâ€™re happy. But could you maybe keep it down? The last time you had a puppet love breakup, I thought there was a real argument next door!â€ David blushed. â€œSorry about that! Itâ€™s just, when puppet love goes sour, things can get intense!â€ As Mrs. Jenkins left, David turned back to his puppets. The interruption had given him an ideaâ€”why not throw a wedding crasher into the mix? Enter Sir Woofington, the dashing yet slightly clumsy dog puppet who had always secretly harbored feelings for Lady Snuggles. â€œI object!â€ Sir Woofington barked, bursting through an imaginary door (which was actually Davidâ€™s other hand). â€œPuppet love canâ€™t be confined to just one pair of hands!â€ David chuckled at his own joke, proud of his quick thinking. He decided to resolve the love triangle in the most unexpected way possibleâ€”by having Mr. Fluffy invite Sir Woofington to be his best puppet at the wedding. After all, nothing says puppet love like forgiveness and friendship! And so, with the string quartet back on their feet (thanks to a little assistance from David), the puppet love wedding went off without a hitch. Well, except for the part where Mr. Fluffyâ€™s ring got stuck on Lady Snugglesâ€™ paw, leading to a round of puppet love laughter from David himself. As David took his final bow, or rather, made his puppets bow, he realized something importantâ€”puppet love wasnâ€™t just about the stories he created; it was about the joy of bringing these characters to life, one over-the-top scene at a time. And so, Davidâ€™s epic puppet love saga continued, with each day bringing a new adventure, a new laugh, and perhaps a few more puzzled looks from Mrs. Jenkins next door. But to David, there was no greater joy than seeing his puppets live happily ever after in their own world of endless puppet love. ğŸ­ğŸ’– ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Puppet love with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

Creating Film Hooks #filmmaking In this clip I talk about creating film hooks in my comedy feature film B-Movie. In the world of cinema, where countless movies compete for viewersâ€™ attention, creating film hooks at the beginning of a feature film is not just a good ideaâ€”itâ€™s essential. These hooks are the magnetic forces that draw viewers in, piquing their interest and ensuring they stay glued to the screen until the credits roll. Letâ€™s explore why creating film hooks is so vital in keeping audiences engaged. First and foremost, creating film hooks at the outset of a movie sets the tone and establishes the filmâ€™s identity. In the first few minutes, audiences form their initial impressions. A powerful hook can immediately immerse viewers in the story, creating a sense of curiosity and anticipation. Whether itâ€™s an intriguing opening scene, a mysterious character introduction, or a compelling conflict, creating film hooks helps to pull the audience into the narrative, making them want to know more. Moreover, creating film hooks is crucial in an era where attention spans are shrinking. With so much content available at our fingertips, viewers can easily switch off or move on to another movie if the beginning doesnâ€™t grab their interest. By creating film hooks that are strong and engaging, filmmakers can capture the audienceâ€™s attention quickly, preventing them from losing interest. A well-crafted hook ensures that viewers are invested right from the start, making it more likely they will stay engaged until the end. Creating film hooks also serves as a powerful tool for setting up the plot. A hook can introduce a central theme, hint at future twists, or pose a question that the audience will be eager to see answered. This creates a narrative thread that runs throughout the film, maintaining tension and interest. By skillfully creating film hooks, filmmakers can keep the audience on the edge of their seats, eager to see how the story unfolds. Additionally, creating film hooks can be an effective way to establish an emotional connection with the audience. A hook that resonates emotionallyâ€”whether through humor, suspense, or dramaâ€”can create a bond between the viewers and the characters or story. This emotional engagement is key to keeping the audience invested in the outcome of the film. By creating film hooks that tap into universal emotions, filmmakers can ensure that their movie leaves a lasting impression. Another reason why creating film hooks is so important is that it can differentiate a film from others in the genre. In a crowded market, a unique or unexpected hook can make a film stand out, attracting attention and generating buzz. This initial intrigue can lead to word-of-mouth recommendations, drawing even more viewers to the movie. By creating film hooks that are original and memorable, filmmakers can increase the chances of their film being noticed and appreciated. Finally, creating film hooks can lay the groundwork for a satisfying payoff. A well-executed hook not only captures attention but also sets up expectations. If the film delivers on the promise of the hook, it can leave audiences feeling satisfied and fulfilled. This sense of resolution can be the difference between a movie that is merely watched and one that is loved and recommended. By carefully creating film hooks that align with the storyâ€™s ultimate payoff, filmmakers can craft a more cohesive and impactful viewing experience. In conclusion, creating film hooks at the beginning of a feature film is a powerful strategy for ensuring that viewers remain engaged from start to finish. ğŸ¬ These hooks capture attention, set the tone, establish emotional connections, and differentiate the film from others. In a world where competition for audience attention is fierce, creating film hooks is not just a good ideaâ€”itâ€™s essential for success. So, whether youâ€™re a filmmaker or a movie enthusiast, always remember the importance of those first few moments. They could be the key to a filmâ€™s lasting impact. ğŸ¥âœ¨ ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Creating Film Hooks with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

B-Movie is FINISHED #vlog Iâ€™ve finally finished my feature film B-Movie. Hereâ€™s ai in the style of Scooby Doo to flesh out the next bit. Ruh-roh! Like, have you ever wondered what itâ€™s like for a filmmaker to finally finish post-production on a movie theyâ€™ve been working on for, like, forever? Well, let me tell you a story about our good pal Kevin Durham and his groovy comedy feature film, B-Movie. After spending 18 months on this wild ride, Kevin was more relieved than Scooby when he finds a box of Scooby Snacks! ğŸ˜‹ You see, B-Movie wasnâ€™t just any movie. It was a passion project that Kevin poured his heart and soul into, from the first shot to the last laugh. And boy, when he finally put the finishing touches on it, it was like unmasking the villain at the end of a mystery! â€œJinkies! I did it!â€ Kevin must have shouted. And, like, who could blame him? 18 months is a long time to be working on anythingâ€”especially when it involves comedy, where timing is everything. ğŸ¬ Now, Kevin wasnâ€™t just any filmmaker; he was a guy who loved his craft, just like Scooby loves a good snack! ğŸ¾ But after 18 months of late nights, early mornings, and countless hours in the editing room, Kevin finally saw B-Movie come to life. Like, it was all thereâ€”the jokes, the gags, the slapstick humorâ€”and it all clicked together like Velma finding the last piece of a puzzle. It was a moment of sheer joy for Kevin, a feeling that all filmmakers dream of when they start a project. He probably thought, â€œZoinks! I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s done!â€ Finishing B-Movie wasnâ€™t just about completing a task. For Kevin, it was about seeing a long-term vision come to fruition. Itâ€™s like when the gang finally catches the bad guyâ€”itâ€™s not just the end, itâ€™s the payoff for all the hard work, all the clues gathered, and all the creepy situations survived. In this case, Kevinâ€™s hard work was turning an idea into a full-fledged comedy feature film. B-Movie wasnâ€™t just a film; it was a part of Kevinâ€™s life for a year and a half. So, when it was finally done, the sense of accomplishment was like catching the ghost in the haunted mansion and finding out it was just old Mr. Jenkins after all! But wait, like, thereâ€™s more! Kevin wasnâ€™t just happy to finish B-Movieâ€”he was thrilled to move onto his next adventure! You know how Shaggy and Scooby are always ready for the next big mystery, no matter how many ghouls and goblins theyâ€™ve faced? Well, thatâ€™s exactly how Kevin felt. After B-Movie wrapped, he was excited to dive into his next project. He was pumped to explore new ideas, create new stories, and face new filmmaking challenges. For Kevin, each project is like a new mystery to solve, and he couldnâ€™t wait to jump into the next one. In the end, Kevinâ€™s journey with B-Movie was a wild, exciting rideâ€”like being chased by a werewolf in a foggy swamp! But unlike Shaggy, whoâ€™d rather be anywhere else, Kevin was all in, committed to every frame of his film. When he finally finished, it was the ultimate victory, like when the Mystery Machine rolls off into the sunset after another case closed. And just like Scooby and the gang, Kevin knew that while B-Movie was one groovy accomplishment, there were plenty more mysteriesâ€”er, moviesâ€”waiting just around the corner. So, thatâ€™s the story, gang! When Kevin Durham finally completed post-production on B-Movie, it was a moment of triumph, excitement, and, like, total grooviness. ğŸ‰ Now, heâ€™s ready for the next big adventure, because just like Scooby-Doo, thereâ€™s always another mystery waiting to be solved, and another film waiting to be made! ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Feature Film FINISHED with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

Judd Apatow's Best Filmmaking Tip #shorts Judd Apatowâ€™s film making tip had a massive impact on my feature film B-Movie. Judd Apatow is a name synonymous with modern comedy, a filmmaker who has reshaped the landscape of humor in cinema over the past two decades. From his early days as a writer on â€œThe Larry Sanders Showâ€ to directing and producing iconic films like *The 40-Year-Old Virgin* and *Knocked Up*, Apatow has left an indelible mark on the comedy genre. His influence extends beyond just the success of his own films; Apatow has become a mentor to a new generation of comedy filmmakers, many of whom have adopted what could be called â€œJudd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip.â€ **Judd Apatowâ€™s Best Filmmaking Tip: The Power of Authenticity** One of the key elements that set Apatowâ€™s films apart is their authenticity. Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip is to prioritize genuine emotion and relatable characters over contrived plot devices and cheap laughs. This focus on authenticity has revolutionized the way comedy films are made, as it emphasizes the importance of crafting characters and stories that resonate with audiences on a deeper level. Rather than relying on over-the-top scenarios, Apatowâ€™s films often find humor in the everyday struggles of life, making his work both hilarious and heartfelt. This approach has been a guiding principle for many new comedy filmmakers who have been inspired by Apatowâ€™s work. The likes of Seth Rogen, Jason Segel, and Lena Dunham, all of whom were mentored by Apatow, have incorporated this emphasis on authenticity into their own projects. By following Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip, these filmmakers have created their own successful careers while also contributing to the evolution of the comedy genre. **Judd Apatowâ€™s Best Filmmaking Tip: Collaboration Is Key** Another aspect of Apatowâ€™s influence is his commitment to collaboration. Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip includes the belief that collaboration among writers, directors, and actors is essential to creating a successful comedy film. Apatow often works closely with his cast and crew, encouraging improvisation and creative input at all stages of production. This collaborative spirit has led to some of the most memorable moments in his films, as it allows for a fluid and dynamic creative process. Apatowâ€™s emphasis on collaboration has been adopted by many of the filmmakers he has worked with and mentored. For instance, Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg, who started as writers for Apatow, have gone on to direct and produce their own films, like *Superbad* and *This Is the End*. These films carry the same collaborative energy that Apatow instilled in them, proving that Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip can lead to not only successful films but also thriving creative partnerships. Beyond just making people laugh, Apatow has always used comedy as a way to comment on society. Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip includes the idea that comedy should not only entertain but also provoke thought and discussion. His films often tackle serious issues like relationships, parenthood, and personal growth, all while maintaining a comedic tone. This balance of humor and social commentary has made Apatowâ€™s work not just entertaining, but also meaningful. This approach has been particularly influential on the next generation of comedy filmmakers. Many have adopted Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip, using their films to explore contemporary social issues in a way that is both funny and insightful. For example, films like *Booksmart* and *Eighth Grade* tackle issues like identity, friendship, and the pressures of adolescence, all while maintaining a comedic sensibility. These films owe much to Apatowâ€™s pioneering approach to blending humor with social relevance. **Conclusion: The Legacy of Judd Apatowâ€™s Best Filmmaking Tip** In conclusion, Judd Apatowâ€™s influence on the world of comedy filmmaking cannot be overstated. His commitment to authenticity, collaboration, and the embrace of imperfection has reshaped the genre, inspiring a new generation of filmmakers to follow in his footsteps. By adhering to Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip, these filmmakers have created works that are not only hilarious but also deeply resonant and relevant. As we look to the future of comedy, it is clear that Judd Apatowâ€™s best filmmaking tip will continue to guide and inspire filmmakers for years to come. His impact on the genre has been profound, and his legacy will be felt in every laugh, every tear, and every moment of truth that his successors bring to the screen. ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Judd Apatowâ€™s Filmmaking Tip with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

Sombrero Movie #shorts A clip from my upcoming feature film B-Movie. Hereâ€™s ai to fill in the gaps. In the small town of Santa Fe Springs, a sombrero possessed by a vengeful spirit comes to life, wreaking havoc and terror. A young historian and a skeptical detective must unravel its dark past to save their town. The film opens in Santa Fe Springs, a small town steeped in folklore and rich cultural heritage. The annual â€œFiesta de Santa Feâ€ is approaching, and the townspeople are busy preparing for the festivities. Meanwhile, **Maria Lopez**, a passionate historian working at the local museum, discovers an old, intricately embroidered sombrero while cataloging artifacts in the museumâ€™s dusty basement. The sombrero catches Mariaâ€™s eye because of its beautiful craftsmanship and mysterious aura. Despite warnings from her colleague, **Javier**, about the object being cursed, Maria decides to include it in the museumâ€™s exhibit for the fiesta, hoping to attract more visitors. Unbeknownst to them, this decision sets off a chain of supernatural events that will soon engulf the town. That night, as Maria locks up the museum, the camera pans to the sombrero. The lights flicker, and shadows dance across the walls. The scene ends with the sombrero twitching slightly, hinting at its impending awakening. The next morning, rumors spread about strange occurrences around town. Livestock go missing, mysterious sounds echo through the night, and several townspeople report seeing a shadowy figure wearing a large hat roaming the streets. Maria dismisses these incidents as coincidental and continues to prepare for the fiesta. Meanwhile, **Detective Alex Ramirez**, a skeptical and pragmatic investigator from the neighboring city, arrives in Santa Fe Springs to visit family. He gets pulled into the unfolding chaos when his cousin becomes one of the missing persons. At first, Alex is dismissive of the townspeopleâ€™s superstitions but soon realizes something sinister is afoot. The sombrero, now fully awakened, embarks on a mission of revenge against the descendants of those who wronged its original owner, **Don Francisco Ortega**, a famed but ill-treated performer from the early 1900s. Don Francisco was wrongly accused of a crime and executed, but his spirit remained trapped within his beloved sombrero, waiting for the chance to exact vengeance. As the town falls deeper into chaos, Maria and Detective Alex team up to investigate the origins of the cursed sombrero. Their research leads them to uncover a hidden chapter of Santa Fe Springsâ€™ history involving betrayal, false accusations, and a powerful curse. They realize that the sombrero targets the descendants of those who orchestrated Don Franciscoâ€™s demise, and its power grows with every act of violence it commits. **Act 3** The fiesta is in full swing, but the festive atmosphere is overshadowed by fear and unease. The sombrero continues its rampage, now growing more powerful and aggressive. The town descends into panic as Maria and Alex race against time to stop it. The climax of the sombrero movie unfolds as the sombrero arrives at the museum, drawn by its desire for revenge. In a tense and dramatic confrontation, Maria dons the sombrero, offering herself as a vessel for the spirit. Her heartfelt plea for forgiveness and understanding weakens the sombreroâ€™s hold, allowing the ritual to take effect. The sombrero resists at first, but Mariaâ€™s sincerity and the collective support of the townspeople ultimately break the curse. In a spectacular display of light and energy, Don Franciscoâ€™s spirit is finally freed, and the sombrero falls lifeless to the ground. With the curse lifted, Santa Fe Springs begins to heal. The townspeople commemorate Don Franciscoâ€™s legacy with a memorial, recognizing both his talents and the injustices he suffered. Maria and Alex reflect on their journey, grateful for the unlikely friendship they forged and the peace they restored. The film ends with a shot of the museum, now bustling with visitors eager to learn about the townâ€™s history. As the camera pans across the exhibit, it lingers on the now-harmless sombrero, resting peacefully in a glass caseâ€”a reminder of the power of forgiveness and the enduring spirit of justice. The credits roll, accompanied by a haunting yet hopeful musical score, leaving audiences with a sense of closure and the enduring impact of this unique sombrero movie. ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Sombrero Movie with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

Charity Shop Cheapskate #shorts A clip from my feature film titled B-Movie. Hereâ€™s ai to fill in the gaps. It was a bright and sunny afternoon when Ben strolled down the main street of Crystal Cove, feeling particularly pleased with himself. As the townâ€™s resident bargain hunter, Ben prided himself on being able to haggle his way to the best deals. Everyone knew him as the â€œcharity shop cheapskate,â€ a title he wore like a badge of honor. He believed there was no price too low to negotiate. On this particular day, Ben was on the hunt for a good movie to watch that evening. He spotted a sign for a charity shop, â€œMystery Mart,â€ hanging over the entrance of a little store he had never noticed before. Its bell jingled as he pushed the door open, and the familiar smell of old books and second-hand treasures wafted toward him. Inside, the shelves were lined with an assortment of odds and ends, and at the back of the shop, Benâ€™s eyes locked onto a shelf filled with DVDs. The fluorescent lights flickered slightly, casting an eerie glow on the rows of neatly stacked movies. â€œZoinks, jackpot!â€ Ben exclaimed to himself, rubbing his hands together with glee. As he scanned through the collection, his eyes fell upon a rare, classic horror film, â€œThe Phantom of Crystal Cove.â€ He had heard about its chilling storyline and legendary status among collectors. Ben grabbed the DVD and sauntered over to the counter, where an elderly shop assistant, Ms. Haggins, stood polishing a pair of spectacles perched on her nose. She glanced at Ben over the rims of her glasses, a welcoming smile on her face. â€œGood afternoon! Found something you like?â€ she asked cheerfully. Ben, in his usual fashion, leaned casually on the counter, holding up the DVD. â€œHow much for this classic?â€ he inquired, trying to sound as nonchalant as possible. Ms. Haggins adjusted her glasses and peered at the price sticker. â€œThatâ€™s $5, dear. All proceeds go to the local animal shelter.â€ â€œFive dollars? Like, yikes, thatâ€™s way too steep for a charity shop!â€ Ben replied, channeling his inner cheapskate instincts. â€œHow about I give you two bucks? Itâ€™s for charity, after all.â€ Ms. Hagginsâ€™ smile faded, and she straightened up, her eyes narrowing slightly. â€œFive dollars is already a bargain for such a rare film,â€ she replied firmly, but politely. â€œItâ€™s for a good cause, young man.â€ But Ben, the charity shop cheapskate, was not one to back down easily. â€œCome on, this is a charity shop! Surely you can lower the price a bit. How about three bucks?â€ â€œListen here, young man,â€ Ms. Haggins said, her voice taking on a steely edge. â€œWeâ€™re trying to help those in need, not line the pockets of a charity shop cheapskate.â€ Ben felt a chill run down his spine. The shop felt eerily silent, as if waiting for his next move. His resolve faltered, but his reputation as a charity shop cheapskate urged him to make one last attempt. â€œAlright, how about four bucks? Iâ€™m practically giving it away at that price,â€ Ben said, trying to muster some bravado. Ms. Haggins let out a deep sigh, her patience clearly wearing thin. â€œThe price is five dollars, and thatâ€™s final. If you want to support a good cause, pay the full amount or leave the item for someone who will.â€ Realizing he had pushed too far, Ben felt the weight of his cheapskate tendencies come crashing down. He could see that his antics had truly angered the kindly shop assistant, and guilt crept in. With a sheepish grin, Ben reached into his pocket and pulled out a crumpled five-dollar bill. â€œAlright, alright, you win, Ms. Haggins. Iâ€™ll pay the full price,â€ he conceded, handing over the money. Ms. Hagginsâ€™ expression softened as she took the money and rang up the sale. â€œThank you for supporting our cause. I hope you enjoy the movie.â€ Ben left the shop, DVD in hand, feeling both humbled and relieved. As he walked home, he couldnâ€™t shake the feeling that he had learned something important about the true value of things and the spirit of giving. Later that night, as Ben settled in to watch his newly acquired film, he reflected on the dayâ€™s events. The charity shop cheapskate had met his match, and he knew heâ€™d think twice before trying to haggle over a good cause again. The mystery of the flickering lights and eerie atmosphere in the shop lingered in his mind, a reminder that some bargains were worth more than their monetary value. From then on, Ben was determined to shed his title as the charity shop cheapskate and become a true supporter of those in need. ğŸ”´ Subscribe for more comedy clips https://www.youtube.com/user/skinnywristfilms?sub_confirmation=1 ğŸ”´ Share this video Charity Shop Cheapskate with a YouTube Friend âœ… Check out more about me and what I do Home Follow me Instagram â€“ https://www.instagram.com/thekevindurham Twitter â€“ https://twitter.com/thekevindurham/ Facebook â€“ http://facebook.com/thekevindurham

Clown Kink REVEALED #shorts This is a clip from my upcoming feature film titled B-Movie. Ben and Kevin had been friends since college. They shared a love of indie music, bad puns, and action movies. Both worked at the same marketing firm, and it was rare to see one without the other. One Friday, Ben and Kevin went out for their usual post-work drink at their favorite bar. As they settled into their seats and ordered their usual beers, Kevin seemed more jittery than usual. â€œWhatâ€™s up, Kev?â€ Ben asked, noticing Kevinâ€™s unusual restlessness. Kevin hesitated, glancing around to make sure no one else was listening. â€œAlright, but you have to promise not to freak out,â€ he said. Intrigued, Ben leaned in closer. â€œOkay, shoot,â€ he replied. Kevin took a deep breath. â€œI have a clown kink,â€ he said, his voice barely above a whisper. Ben blinked in surprise, taking a moment to process the words. â€œWait, what? Clown kink revealed?â€ he said, trying to stifle a laugh. Kevin nodded, a little red in the face but relieved to have said it out loud. â€œYeah, I know it sounds weird. Iâ€™ve just always been into clowns, ever since I was a kid. Thereâ€™s something about the colors and the makeup. I just find itâ€¦ exciting.â€ The revelation was unexpected, but Benâ€™s curiosity was piqued. â€œSo, like, what do you do? Do you dress up like a clown or something?â€ he asked, genuinely interested. Kevin nodded, a shy smile spreading across his face. â€œYeah, sometimes I do. I have a whole costume and everything. Itâ€™s not just the outfit, though. Itâ€™s the whole personaâ€”being someone else entirely.â€ Ben was intrigued by this side of Kevin that heâ€™d never seen before. â€œWow, clown kink revealed, indeed. So, is it just you, or do you get other people involved?â€ Kevin laughed, relaxing now that Ben hadnâ€™t reacted negatively. â€œSometimes my girlfriend gets in on it too. She thinks itâ€™s fun, and honestly, itâ€™s great having someone who doesnâ€™t judge.â€ As they talked, Ben realized how much he admired Kevinâ€™s honesty. He thought about how he had always been too afraid to share his own quirks and interests with others. â€œMan, clown kink revealed, and here I was thinking I knew everything about you,â€ Ben said, shaking his head with a smile. Over the next few weeks, the phrase â€œclown kink revealedâ€ became a running joke between them. They joked about Kevinâ€™s secret life as a clown, and Ben often teased Kevin about what kind of balloon animals he could make. Despite the humor, Ben found himself thinking about how everyone has aspects of themselves that they keep hidden from the world. One evening, Kevin invited Ben over for dinner. As they sat in the living room, Kevin asked, â€œSo, what about you, Ben? Any secrets you want to reveal?â€ Ben hesitated, then decided to share something heâ€™d never told anyone before. â€œWell, since clown kink revealed and all that, I guess itâ€™s my turn,â€ he said, grinning. â€œIâ€™ve always been into cosplay.
